name: Die Grünen
comment: Name change 1993 from Grüne Alternativen (The Green

name: Sozialdemokratische Partei Österreichs
english: The Social Democratic Party of Austria
comment: Until 1991 Sozialistische Partei Österreichs (Socialist Party of Austria)

name: Freiheitliche Partei Osterreichs
comment: The VdU merged with the Freiheitspartei. Parts of the VdU had deserted to this new party. The FPÖ is the result of this merger in 1956.

name: Liberales Forum
comment: Founded 1993 as the liberal wing of FPÖ split.

name: Bündnis Zukunft Österreich
english: Alliance for the future of Austria
comment: Founded in 2005 by a break away by the more pragmatic wing of the FPÖ

name: Parti Communiste Beige/Kommunistische Partij van Belgie
Belgische Socialistische Partij/Parti Socialiste Beige
english: Dutch and French names of the unitary Belgian Socialist Party
comment: Before 1979

name: Socialistische Partij
english: [Flemish] Socialist Party) Socialistische Partij — Anders Spa
comment: Known as the BSP (Belgische Socialistische Partij from December 1978, when the unitary Socialist Party split. From March 1980 it became SP. Changed name to Spa in 2001. Cartel with Spirit from the election in 2003. Spirit is a split off from Volksunie 2001, in 2008 Spirit changed name to Vlaams Progressieven (Flemish Progressives.

name: Parti Socialiste
comment: Born with the split of the unitary Socialist Party in December 1978

name: AGALEV = Anders Gaan Leven
comment: Since 1982. Changed name in 2003 to Groen (Green)

name: ECOLO = Ecologistes Confederes pour l'Organisation de Luttes Originales
comment: Since 1981

name: Rassemblement Walion
comment: Since 1969

name: Front Democratique des Francophones Democratic Front of French-speakers)
comment: Since 1964. Since 1993, the party belongs to the PRL-FDF Federation.

name: Christelijke Volkspartij/Parti Social-Chretien
english: Dutch and French names of the unitary Christian Democrat Party
comment: Before 1968

name: Christelijke Volkspartij
english: Christian People's Party) Christen Democratisch en Vlaams CD&V
comment: Born with the split of the unitary Christian Democratic Party in 1968. Changed name in 2001 to CD&V.

name: Parti Social Chretien
english: Christian Social Party) Centre Democrat Humaniste cdH
comment: Born with the split of the unitary Christian Democratic Party in 1968. Changed name in 2002 to cdH

name: Volksunie
english: People's Union) Nieuw Vlaams Alliantie N VA, New Flemish Alliance
comment: Since 1954. VU split in 2001 into N-VA and Spirit

name: Liberale Partij/Parti Liberal
english: Dutch and French names of the unitary Liberal Party
comment: The party remained unitary until 1972. The French speaking part of the unitary party (PL) changed its name to PLP=Parti de la Liberte et du Progres (Freedom and Progress Party) in 1961. It remained the same until 1976 while the Flemish Liberals chose the name of PVV=Partij voor Vrijheid en Vooruitgang (Freedom and Progress Party) in 1972, when the unitary party split along linguistic lines.

name: Vlaamse Liberalen en Democraten
comment: Known as PVV from 1972, but changed name in 1992 to VLD.

name: Parti Reformateur Liberal
english: Liberal Reform Party) Mouvement Reformateur MR, Reform movement
comment: Known as PLP from 1961. In 1976, the PRLW=Parti Reformateur et Liberal de Wallonie (Reform and Liberal Party from Wallonia) formed with the joining of several RW leading members to the Walloon liberals. The Brussels francophone Liberals remained autonomous for most part of the 1970's but finally merged with the PRLW to form the PRL in 1979. Note that since 1993, the party works as a federation with the FDF under the name PRL-FDF. MR from 2002, a federation of PRL, MCC (a Christian Democrat split oft) and FDF.

name: Union Democrate pour le Respect du Travail
english: Democratic Union for the Respect of Work
comment: Since 1978

name: Front National
comment: Since 1985

name: Vlaams Blok
english: Flemish Bloc) Vlaams Belang Flemish Interest
comment: Since 1978. Vlaams Blok disbanded itself in 2004 after being convicted by the Court of Appeal for repeated incitement to discrimination, and founded the successor Vlaams Belang

name: Lijst Dedecker
comment: LDD first took part in elections in 2007. Conservative liberalism mixed with striving for more Flemish independence. Changed name in 2011 to Libertarian, Direct, Democratic.

name: Balgarska Sotsialisticheska Partiya
english: Bulgarian Socialist Party; Coalition for Bulgaria

name: Grazdani za Evropejsko Razvitie na Balgaria
english: Citizens for European Development of Bulgaria

name: Anorthotikon Komma Ergazomenou Laou
english: Progressive Party of the Working People

name: Enomenoi Dimokrates
comment: Formed in 1996 by KED and ADISOK

name: Evropaiko Komma
comment: Formed in 2006 by NEO and AD IK

name: Kinima Sosialdemokration Eniaia Dimokratiki Enosi Kentrou
comment: Ran as KISOS in 2001

name: Hnuti za Samospravnou Demokracii-Spolecnost pro Moravu a Slezsko
Krest'anska a DemokratickäUnie — Ceskoslovenska Strana Lidova
Komunistická Strana Cech a Moravy
english: Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia

name: Sdruzeni pro Republiku - Republikánská Strana Ceskoslovenska
Partei des Demokratischen Sozialismus
english: Party of Democratic Socialism) Die Linke The Left
comment: From 2007 The left after a merger between The Left Party/PDS and WASG (Arbeit und Soziale Gerechtigkeit — Die Wahlalternative, consisting of dissafected SPD members and the Labour movement), which had formed an electoral alliance in 2005.

name: Die Grünen
comment: Official name since 1993: Bündnis '90-Die Grünen

name: Bündnis '90
comment: Joined the Greens in 1993

name: Christlich Demokratische Union Deutschlands
english: CDU - Christian Democratic Union) and Christlich-Soziale Union in Bayern CSU - Christian Social Union

name: Gesamtdeutscher Block/Bund der Heimatlosen und Entrechteten
Freie Volkspartei
comment: Earlier named Demokratische Arbeitsgemeinschaft (DA)

name: Ny Alliance
comment: Founded in 2007. Changed name to Liberal Alliance in 2009

name: Horn Batasuna
comment: Electoral participation under three names, HB, Euskal Herritarrok and EHAK. Banned from electoral participation since 2003

name: Izquerda Unida
comment: United Left after 1989.

name: Partido Socialista Obrero Espanol
comment: Founded in 1879, absorbed several minor socialist groups

name: Union de Centro Democritico
comment: Founded in 1977 and disappeared after the 1982 election.

name: Coalition Canaria
english: Independent Groupings of Canary; Canary Coalition
comment: Canary Coalition after 1993

name: Partido Popular
comment: Founded in 1977 as AP (Alianza Popular). Sponsored the formation of electoral coalition under the names of CD (Coalicion Democratica) and CP (Coalici6n Popular), becoming the Popular Party alter the disbandment of CD after the 1986 election.

name: Bloque Nacionalista Gallego
comment: Gallician nationalist political alliance formed in 1982

name: Isamaa ja Res Publica Liit
english: Union of Pro Patria and Res Publica

name: Sotsiaaldemokraatlik Erakond
comment: 1992-2004: Moodukad (Moderates)

name: (Finnish People's Democratic Union)
comment: Before 1990 = Suomen Kansan Demokraattinen Liitto (Finnish People's Democratic Union)

name: Työväen ja Pienviljelijöiden Sosialidemokraattinen Liitto
english: Social Democratic League of Workers and Smallholder
comment: Before 1959 = Sosialidemokraattinen Oppositio (Social Democratic Opposition)

name: Suomen Keskusta
english: Center Party of Finland) Keskustapuolue Center Party
comment: 1906-1965 = Maalaisliitto (Agrarian Union), 1965-1988 = Keskustapuolue (Center Party)

name: Suomen Maaseudun Puolue
english: Finnish Rural Party) True Films Perussuomalaiset), was formed after the dissolution of the Finnish Rural Party in 1995.
comment: Before 1966 = Small Farmer's Party of Finland (Suomen Pienviljelijäin Iuolue). True Finns was formed after the dissolution of the Finnish Rural Party in 1995.

name: Liberaalinen Kansanpuolue
comment: 1918-1951 = National Progressive Party (Kansallinen Edistyspuolue ), 1951-1965 = Suomen Kansanpuolue (Finnish People's Party). Changed name to Liberals from 2001

name: Suomen Kristillinen Liitto
english: Christian League of Finland) Kristillisdemokraatit Christian Democrats).
comment: Name was changed to Christian Democrats in 2001

name: Socialists
comment: Includes: Section Francaise de l'Internationde Ouvriere (SIFO) 1958-1962, Federation de la Gauche Democraque et Socialiste (FGDS) 1967-1968, Part, Socialiste (PS) 1973 , Mouvement des Radicaux de Gauche (MRG) 1978-1997 (from 1998 PRG, Parti Radical de Gauche, see 12)

name: Center Left Parties
comment: Includes: Parti Radical-Socialist and Entente Democratique (ED) 1958-1962, Mouvement Reformateur (Ref) 1973-1997. 1997-2002 RCV (parliamentary group): Radical— citoyen — vert), consisting of Parti radical-socialiste (later PRG), MdC (Le Mouvement des citoyens, later MRC), Parti communiste reunionnais, Convergences ecologie solidarite, and ainsi que plusiers elus non-inscrits de gauche.

name: Center Right Parties
comment: Mouvement Republicain Populaire (MRP) and Centre Democratique (CD) 1958-1967, Centre Democrate (CD) 1967, Proges et Democratie Moderne (PDM) 1968, Centre Democratie et Progres (CDP) 1973-1978, Union du Centre (UC) and Centre des Democrates Sociaux (CDS) 1988-1993 (French Christian Democrats)
cpd_id: CR; MRP; CD; PDM; CDP; UC; CDS

name: Moderate Conservative Parties Mouvement Democrate
comment: Includes: Centre National des Independants (CNI) 1958- 1962, Federation National des Republicains Independants (FNRI) and Parti Republicain (PR) 1962- 1978 (independent of UDF 1998 as Democratie Liberale, DL, that joined UMP in 2002), Union pour la Democratie Francaise (UDF) 1978-2006. UDF succeeded by MD (Mouvement Democrate) in 2007, which caused the foundation of Le Noveau Centre (see 13).

name: Gaullist Parties Union pour un Mouvement Populaire, UMP
comment: Union pour la Nouvelle Republique (UNR) 1958-1962, Union Democratique pour la V° Republique (UDV) 1967-1968, Union des Democrats pour la Republique (UDR) 1968-1978, Rassemblement pour la Republique (RPR) 1978-2002. UMP founded as merger of RPR, DL, and defectors from UDF.

name: Unite de la Republique
comment: Deputies elected in Algeria (1958-1962)

name: Les Verts
comment: Founded in 1982. Part of Left green coalition in 1997 and the RCV group). From elections 2002 coded as LV but the party was represented earlier without being recorded as a separate party.

name: Part Radical de Gauche
comment: Founded 1971, PRG successor to MRG. Part of the RCV group in 1997elections, but from the elections 2002 coded separately as PRG.

name: Le Nouveau Centre
comment: Founded 2007. Splinter from UDF due to the creation of MD which distanced itself from the UMP.

name: Liberal Party Liberal Democrats
comment: Liberale merged with SDP to form the Liberal Democrats 1988

name: Social Democratic Party
comment: Dissolved 1988, merged with Liberale to form the Liberal Democrats

name: Kommonounistiko Komma Hellados
comment: Historic communist grouping—the only orthodox Marxist-Leninist party of Greece.

name: Kommounistiko Komma Elladas-Esoterikou
comment: In 1987 KKR-Interior split into two separate parties, the Communist Party of the Interior-Renewed Left and the Greek Left. In 1989, it joined forces with SYN.

name: Symmachia Proodeftikon kai Aristeron Dynameon
english: Alliance of Progressive and Left Wing Forces
comment: Alliance in 1977 election of KKE-es, United Democratic Left, Socialist March, Christian Democracy, and Socialist Initiative. The main support of the Alliance was from EDA, which polled a very small percentage of the vote when it ran alone in 1981. In 1985 EDA made an electoral coalition with PASOK and managed to elect its leader as MP.

name: Omospondia Oikologikon kai Enallarktokon Organoseon
english: Federation of Ecological and Alternative Organizations
comment: Formed from 80-odd environmentalist groupings, the Federation was the most prominent of a number of green formations. Won one seat in Nov. 1989, retained in April 1990, but in following elections did not gain any seats and split into smaller green parties.

name: Synaspismos tis aristeras kai tis proodou
english: Coalition of the left and progress) SYRIZA Synaspismos Rizospastikis Aristeras) from 2004.
comment: Alliance of the Greek Left, the Communist Party of Greece and a number of minor leftist forces. (KKE formally withdrew from the Coalition in 1991). In 2004 merger of several small parties/movements into SYRIZA where SYN the most important.

name: Dimokratiko Koinoniko Kinima
comment: Center-leftist party formed by a breakaway group from PASOK in 1995. In elections 2007 part of SYRIZA (see SYN)

name: Panhellinio Sosialistiko Kinema
comment: Grew out of the Left wing of the Center Union but proved to be quite different from both the old Center and the Communist Left.

name: Enosi Dimokratikou Kentrou
comment: In Feb. 1976, the Center Union changed its name to the Union of the Democratic Center, but soon afterwards, a number of its members started to withdraw. In 1985, it joined forces with PASOK.

name: Neofileleftheroi
comment: Formed by Konstantins Mitsotakis, it claimed to represent the authentic tradition of Venizelist liberalism In 1978, Mitsotakis joined ND.

name: Dimokratiki Ananeosi
comment: Center-right party launched by a group of ND "purists" in 1985 as an alternative to New Democracy. Dissolved 1994

name: Politiki Anoixi
comment: Conservative party formed by a breakaway group from ND in 1993.

name: Nea Democratia
comment: The post-1974 representative of the Conservative tradition. It managed to be presented as a completely new political party from the former ERE.

name: Ethniki Parataxi
comment: Emerged with the demise of the dictatorship representing the extreme right. After 1977 divided into two factions. One ran in 1981 under the name Progressive Party, while MPs from the other faction joined the ND list.

name: Independent Muslims
comment: Although running as independents rather than under party labels, Muslim candidates in Thrace managed to gain 2 seats in the 1989 elections and another 2 seats in the 1990 election.

name: Laikós Orthódoxos Synagermós
comment: Founded in 2000 by Georgias Karatzaferis after being expelled from ND, first gained parliamentary representation in elections 2007. Mix of Euroscepticism, populism and national conservatism

name: Független Kisgazda, Földmunkás es Polgári Párt
Magyar Igazság es Elet Pártja
comment: 2006: MIEF JOBBIK

name: Democratic Left
comment: Before 1992 The Workers Party. Democratic Left from 1992 till 1999 when it merged with the Labour Party under Labour's banner.

name: The Labour Party
comment: Merged with Democratic Left in 1999 under Labour's label

name: Clann na Poblachta
comment: Dissolved 1965

name: Clann na Talmhan
comment: Dissolved 1965

name: Progressive Democrats
comment: Founded 1985 dissolved 2009

name: Sinn Fein
comment: Coded from elections 2002, Irish Left wing nationalists

name: Green Party
comment: Coded from elections 2002

name: Sameiningarflokkur althy8u - s6sialisaflokkur
comment: Joined the electoral alliance PA in 1956, which then evolved into a party.

name: Vinstnhreyfingin - b Cent frarbo8
comment: Founded before elections 1999--mostly the left wing of the PA that did not join the UF. Democratic socialist, feministic and environmental in orientation.

name: Althy0ubandalag
comment: Initially an alliance of the SP and a few members of the SDP (1956). Dissolved 1998.

name: Kvennaflokkur Women's Party;)
comment: Joined the electoral alliance UF in 1999.

name: pjodvarnarflokkurinn
comment: Dead.

name: Samtök frjalslyndra og vinstri manna
comment: Splinter of the PA Dead.

name: pjodvaki-Fylking folksins
comment: Splinter of the SDP. Dead

name: Samfylkingin
comment: An electoral alliance of SDP, PA, and WA

name: Bandalag jafnadarmanna
comment: Splinter of the SDP. Dead.

name: Althyöuflokkur
comment: Joined the electoral alliance UF in 1999.

name: Samtök um jafnretti og felagshyggju
english: Association for Equality and Social Justice
comment: Dead.

name: Frjalslyndi flokkur
comment: Splinter of the IP.

name: Bogaraflokkur
comment: Splinter of the IP. Dead.

name: Borgarahreyfingin
english: The Civic Movement) Hreyfingin The Movement
comment: CM founded in 2009 as a response to the financial crisis. Split between MPs after elections. Successor The Movement was founded

name: Partito della Rifondazione Comunista
comment: DP=Democrazia Proletatia (Proletarian Democracy) 1976-1992, PDUP=Partito di Unità Proleratia per il Communismo (Proletarian Unity for Communism) 1979- 1987, Partito della Rifondazione Comunista from 1992-

name: Partito dei Comunisti Italiani
comment: Since 1998. Co-operated in the centre-left alliance Union in the 2006 elections and in die left alliance, The Left- The Rainbow (La Sinistra – L'Arcobaleno), in the 2008 elections.

name: Partito democratica della Sinistra
english: Democratic Left Party) Democratici di Sinistra Left Democrats
comment: PCI=ltalian Communist Party (Partito Comunista Italiano) 1946-1992. PDS from 1992-98. DS from 1998. In the 2006 elections on a joint list with the DeL as L'Ulivo (the Olive tree). Dissolved in 2007

name: Federazione Nazionale delle liste Verdi
english: National Federation of greens) Fedarazione dei Verdi
comment: Founded 1983. From 1990 Fedarazione dei Verdi alter merger with Rainbow Greens. In elections 2001 joint list with SDI. In 2006 elections part of the Unione coalition In 2008 elections part of the Left-Rainbow coalition

name: La Rete: movimento per la Democrazia
comment: 1992-1999. In 1996 the party changed it name to La Rete per il Partito Democratico and in 1999 it was absorbed by I Democratici (The Democrats, formed by splinters from PPI and others) who later joined the DeL.

name: Partito Radicale
comment: Founded 1976. Joint list with the SDI 2006 as RnP.

name: Socialisti Democratici Italiani
comment: 1998-2007. Joint list with the Greens in 2001 elections. Formed a joint list with PR in the 2006 elections as RnP. Joined a new socialist party (Partito Socialista) in 2007.

name: Partito Popolare Italiano
comment: 1994-2002. Successor to DC. In 1999 Prodi formed I Democratici (The Democrats, splinters from PPI and centre Jeff groups) attracting some of the Christian democratic and social liberal MPs.

name: Rinnovamento Italiano
comment: 1996-2002. In 2002 the party contested the elections as part of the newly formed DeL.

name: Unione Democratica per la Repubblica
english: Democratic Union for the Republic) Unione Democratici per 1 Europa Union of Democrats for Europe), UDEUR
comment: Since 1998. The party split in 1999 and most members joined the UDEUR, later called UDEUR-populars. Part of the DeL list in the 2001 elections but decided not to stay when DeL in 2006 contested the elections as one party. Part of the Unione coalition in the elections 2006.

name: Centro Cristiano Democratico/Cristiani Democratica Uniti
english: Christian Democratic Centre/United Christian Democrats) Unione dei Democratici Cristiani e di Centro Union of Christian and Centre Democrats), and Unione di Centro
comment: CCD 1994- and CDU 1996. The parties joined forces in 1996. CDU merged with UDR in 1998. From 2002 UDC was created after merger of CCD, CDU and Democrazia Europea. Contested the 2008 elections in coalition under a joint list with Movimento Fedarativo Civico Popolare, Partito della Democrazia Cristiana and Partito Democratico Cristiano as Unione di Centro.

name: Forza Italia Il Popolo della Libertà
comment: Founded 1994. In elections 2008 as People of Freedom, PdL, under joint list with AN, Democrazia Christiana per le Autonomie, NPSI and others. From 2009 the party dissolved into the PdL.

name: Monarchist parties
comment: Includes PNM=Partito Nazionale Monarchico (1953-63) and PDIUM=Partito di Unità Monarchica (1948-72)

name: Alleanza Nazionale
comment: Founded in 1995. Successor to MSI that turned more to the centre-right. In coalition under a joint list with FI and others as PdL in the 2008 elections. In 2009 the party dissolved and merged into the PdL.

name: Uomo Qualunque and Movimento Sociale Italiano
Südtiroler Volkspartei
comment: Regional party in the mainly German speaking province of Bozen (Bolzano in Italian). Recorded with seats from elections 2001 but the party were represented earlier but was then not recorded as a separate party.

name: Nuovo Partito Socialista Italiano, NPSI
comment: Founded in 2001, dissolved and merged into PdL 2009. In the 2006 elections the party formed an electoral alliance with DCA (Democrazia Cristiana per le Autonomie, a split from die UdC). Contested the 2008 elections as part of the PdL.

name: Democrazia e Libertà. La Margherita
comment: 2002-2007. Formed by left Christian democrats and other centre and left groups. Merged into PD 2007

name: Italia dei Valori/ Lista di Pietro
comment: Founded in 1998 by Antonio di Pietro, one of die "Clean hands" magistrates. Cooperation with the centre left, favors strict policies against illegal immigration, waste of public money and corruption

name: Rosa nel Pugno
comment: 2005-2007. Founded as an alliance between PR and SDI.

name: Partito Democratico
english: Democratic Party) In 2006 L'Ulivo Olive tree
comment: PD founded in 2007 after merger of DeL, DS and several smaller groups, but die centre left parties had cooperated in alliances since 1996 and the main constituent parties, the DeL and DS, had contested the 2006 elections in joint list as L'Ulivo. In 2006 elections votes for L'Unione are included.

name: Movimento per l'Autonomia
comment: Founded in 2005. Alliance with LN in die 2006 elections. MPs elected an own list since the 2008 elections

name: Lietuvos Socialdemokratu Partija
comment: In 2000 as AB-SDK; in2004 as ABAP- UL which also contained NS-SL; in 2008 as LsdP

name: Naujoji S?junga - Socialliberalai
comment: In alliance with LSDP in 2004

name: Pilietin?s Demokratijos Partija
comment: Breakaway from DP in 2006

name: Rolando Pakso Koalicija UZ Tvarka ir Teisingumas
english: Coalition of Rolandas Paksas For Order and Justice

name: Valstie?iu ir Naujosios Demokratijos Partij? S?jungos
english: Union of Peasants' and New Democracy Parties
comment: From 2005: Lietuvos valstie?i? liaudininku s?junga (LVLS)

name: Lietuvos Respublikos Liberal} Sajunga
english: Liberal Movement of the Republic of Lithuania

name: Kommunistesch Partei Letzebuerg
comment: KPL had had no MP since 1994. It gained 1 seat in 1999 but then as Dei Lenk in coalition with other parties of the left such as the New Left and the Revolutionary Socialist Party. KPL and DL has run separate lists with only the DL gaining parliamentary representation

name: Sozialdemokratesch Partei
comment: From 1974 to 1984

name: Greng Lescht Ekologisch Initiativ
comment: Since 1989 (first election 1989)

name: Electoral Alliance of the green parties
comment: Since 1994, includes GLEI and GAP

name: Greng Alternativ Partei
comment: Since 1983 (first election 1984)

name: Aktiounskomitee fir Demokratie a Rentegerechtegkeet
english: Action Committee for Democracy and Equal Pensions
comment: Since 1987 (first election 1989)

name: Enröles de Force
comment: From 1979 to 1984

name: Socialistes Independants
comment: From 1979 to 1989

name: Mouvement Independant Populaire
comment: From 1964 to 1969

name: Parti des Independants de 1'Est
comment: From 1945 to 1948

name: Jaunas Laiks
comment: Vienotiba in 2010

name: Latvijas Pirmaä Partija-Savieniba Latvijas Cels
comment: Par labu Latviju in 2010

name: Latvijas Socialdemokratiskä Stridnieku Partija
comment: Prior 1999: Latvijas Sociäldemokrätu Apvieniba (Social Democratic Alliance)

name: Apvieniba Tevzemei un Brivibai
comment: Merged with LNNK in 1997; Nacionäla apvieniba in 2010

name: Tautas Kustiba Latvijai - Zigerista Partija
english: Popular movement for Latvia – Siegerist Party

name: Tautas Partija
comment: Par labu Latviju in 2010

name: Centrum Partij - CP
english: Centre Party) and Centum Democraten - CD Centre Democrats

name: Gereformeerd Politiek Verbond
comment: Merged with RPF into CU

name: Reformatorische Politieke Federatie
comment: Merged with GPV into CU

name: Rooms-Katholieke Partij Nederland
english: Roman Catholic Party of the Netherlands

name: Volkspartij voor Vrijheid en Democratie
english: People's Party for Freedom and Democracy

name: Christen Unie
comment: Founded as an alliance between RPF and GPV and formed a common parliamentary party in 2001.

name: Lijst Pim Fortuyn
comment: Created by Pim Fortuyn in 2002 after his dismissal from Leefbar Nederland. The party was dissolved on national level in 2008.

name: Partij voor de Vrijheid
comment: Founded by Geert Wilders after defecting from the VVD in 2004 in protest against the party's positive stance towards Turkish membership in the EU.

name: Farmers' Party
english: Boerempartij - BP) and Rightwing People's Party Rechtse Volkspartij- RVP

name: Norges Kommunistiske Parti/Rad Valgallianse
comment: Before 1961=NKP; From 1973 Red Election Alliance

name: Socialistik Folkeparti
english: Socialist People's Party) Sosialistisk Venstreparti Socialist Left Party
comment: Before 1973 = Sosialistisk Folkeparti, From 1973 in electoral alliance (Socialist People's Party, Communist Party and Democratic Socialists) From 1975 Socialist Left Party

name: Senterpartiet
comment: Before 1959 =Bondepartiet

name: Fremskrittspartiet
comment: Before 1975 = Anders Langes Parti (Anders Langes Party)

name: Porozumienie Ludowe
comment: A break-away 1992: Stronnictwo Luowo-Chrze?cija?skie (SL-CH)

name: Polka. Partia Przyjaciol Piwa.
comment: A faction 1992: Polski Program Ekonomiczny (PPG)

name: Ruch Odrodzenia Polski
english: Movement for the Reconstruction of Poland

name: Samoobrona Rzeczpospolitej Polskiej
english: Self-Defence of the Republic of Poland

name: Partia Demokreczna
comment: Prior 1994: Unia Wolno?ci (JW)

name: Uniao Democratica Popular
english: Democratic Popular Union) Bloco de Esquerda Left Bloc
comment: BE formed in 1999 by left wing parties, among them the UDP

name: Movimento Democratico Popular - Commissao Democratica Eleitoral
Partido Comunista Portugues
english: Portuguese Communist Party) PEV, Partido Ecologista the Greens
comment: PEV has worked in close alliance with PCP since its foundation in 1982

name: Partido de Solidariedade National
comment: 1990-2006. Main focus the protection of pensioners' interest.

name: CDS/PP, Partido do Centro Democratico Social Party
english: Party of the Democratic Social Centre), /Partido Popular People's Party
comment: From 1993 CDS/PP

name: Alianca Democratica
comment: 1980-1982. Includes PSD, CDS and PPM.

name: Partidul Democratiei Sociale din România
comment: Merged with PSDR to form PSD in 2003

name: Partidul Umanist din Romania
english: Humanist Party of Romania) Conservative Party
comment: Now: Partidul Conservator, PC

name: Demokratickâ. Unia Slovenska
english: Democratic Union of Slovakia) group in 1994 before the election
comment: Here constructed as a parliamentary

name: L'udov? Strana - Hnutie za Demokratick? Slovensko
english: People's Party - Movement for Democratic Slovakia

name: Demokratska Stranka Upokojencev Slovenije
english: Democratic Party of Pensioners of Slovenia

name: Slovenska Demokratska Stranka
comment: Prior to 2003: Socialdemokratska Stranka Slovenije (Social Democratic Party)

name: Socialnih Demokrati
comment: Prior to 2005: Zdruzena Lista Socialnih Demokratov (United List of Social Democrats)
